column4: So.. I managed to get a root terminal up from recovery mode, and then had to get a legacy keyboard, because the USB sub-system is not woking.. from here I want to resume the upgrade problem.. but guess what? no networking! no eth0.. sould I have started recovery mode with a switch to enable networking (sigh) ?
up the network yourself if there is no switch?
whatever do you mean, like a comman-line switch?
does eth0 show an ip4 address?
since ip link gave nothing you have to add it. Try ip link add link eth0
Not ernough informantion; type" argument required
maybe the drivers are not loaded yes
what did you tell me to echo > ?
I seem to have misplace a crucual file i wrongly renamed..
that file is automatically created by udev i believe
why are you in rescue mode again?
can't you chroot into your system from the livecd and do what you want from there?

I believe chroot from here should work, but I don't know what you actually want to do. Video driver broken?http://karuppuswamy.com/wordpress/2010/06/02/how-to-chroot-to-ubuntu-using-live-cd-to-fix-grub-rescue-prompt/
what I really want to do is get networking up on the box to hopefully contunue and complete the 12.04 upgrade
